go_data.justification: The integrin alpha8beta1 is associated with nephronectin in a complex, suggesting a role in cell-matrix adhesion.
The presence of alpha8beta1 promotes the development of the ureteric bud in a non-cell-autonomous manner.
Alpha8 is expressed in the metanephric mesenchyme and is downregulated as the mesenchymal cells undergo epithelialization.
The integrin alpha8beta1 is a heterodimer of the extracellular domain of alpha8 and the extracellular domain beta1.
The integrin alpha8beta1 and nephronectin are associated with each other in vivo, suggesting a binding interaction.
